data.title: Pull Request for Issue #4307: String with null value in native methods and allow use of GetXXXArrayElement instead of GetPrimitiveArrayCritical
data.body:
Hi, this is Pull request for Issue  [#4307](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/4307).
It changes following files:  

[/jnigen/NativeCodeGenerator.java](https://github.com/alessandroborges/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-jnigen/src/com/badlogic/gdx/jnigen/NativeCodeGenerator.java)

[/jnigen/parsing/JavaMethodParser.java](https://github.com/AlessandroBorges/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-jnigen/src/com/badlogic/gdx/jnigen/parsing/JavaMethodParser.java)

data.title: Jnigen: add support String with null value in native methods. Also allow use of GetXXXArrayElement instead of GetPrimitiveArrayCritical
data.body:
Hi !
I'd like to submit a pull request which address the issues listed below.
#### Issue details
1. Add support for null String.
   If you pass a null string to a native method, JVM will crash.
2. Allow use GetXXXArrayElements as option to read/write primitive arrays.
   Current jnigen uses GetPrimitiveArrayCritical for all primitive array in JNI side.
   But GetPrimitiveArrayCritical has some constraints, as stalling GC. Would be nice to be able to chose one or other.
#### Reproduction steps/code

To reproduce null String error just compile and run [MyJniClass2](https://github.com/AlessandroBorges/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-jnigen/src/com/badlogic/gdx/jnigen/test/MyJniClass2.java).

There is no bug with GetPrimitiveArrayCritical, just an enhancement. 
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

All.
#### Stacktrace for null String

>  A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
>   EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006a9f3982, pid=1464, tid=6368
>  JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_77-b03) (build 1.8.0_77-b03)
>  Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.77-b03 mixed mode windows-amd64 compressed oops)
>  Problematic frame:
>  V  [jvm.dll+0x143982]
> 
>  Failed to write core dump. Minidumps are not enabled by default on client versions of Windows
> 
>  An error report file with more information is saved as:
>  D:\Users\Livia\Documents\GitHub\libgdx\extensions\gdx-jnigen\hs_err_pid1464.log
> 
>  If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
>    http://bugreport.java.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
#### Proposed Solution

The proposed solution add set/get methods NativeCodeGenerator.java to boolean fields `usePrimitiveArrayCritical` and `supportNullString`
The default values will not change current output of JniGen.

```
boolean usePrimitiveArrayCritical = true;
boolean supportNullString = false;
```

To enable use of **GetXXXArrayElements** , the generator must set `usePrimitiveArrayCritical`as **_false_**.
To allow use of null Strings `supportNullString`must be set as **_true_**.

Example:

```
NativeCodeGenerator jnigen = new NativeCodeGenerator();
jnigen.setUsePrimitiveArrayCritical(false);
jnigen.setSupportNullString(true);
jnigen.generate("src", "bin", "jni", new String[] { "**/MyJniClass2.java" }, null);
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] Android
- [X] iOS (robovm)
- [X] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [X] Linux
- [X] MacOS

data.title: Texture packer now correctly overwrites old file if extension is not .atlas
data.body:
`TexturePackerFileProcessor#process(File[], File)` was hardcoded to delete old pack files only with `.atlas` extension. And in case where `Settings#atlasExtension` has set to custom value it crashes on pack. For example if I use `.pack` extension:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: Error packing images.
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePacker.process(TexturePacker.java:649)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.Test.main(Test.java:7)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
    at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:147)
Caused by: java.lang.Exception: Error processing directory: D:\Temp\pack_test\input
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.FileProcessor.process(FileProcessor.java:157)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePackerFileProcessor.process(TexturePackerFileProcessor.java:145)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.FileProcessor.process(FileProcessor.java:121)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePackerFileProcessor.process(TexturePackerFileProcessor.java:96)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePacker.process(TexturePacker.java:647)
    ... 6 more
Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: A region with the name "test-patch" has already been packed: test-patch
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePacker.writePackFile(TexturePacker.java:297)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePacker.pack(TexturePacker.java:114)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.texturepacker.TexturePackerFileProcessor.processDir(TexturePackerFileProcessor.java:222)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tools.FileProcessor.process(FileProcessor.java:155)
    ... 10 more
```

 Now it extracts extension from `Settings#atlasExtension` and removes old files correctly.

data.title: Hiero BMFont padding order fix (#4295)
data.body:
Fix for issue #4295.

Notice that there's actually a discrepancy in LibGDX with itself.
BitmapFontWriter writes:  up, down, left, right
BMFontUtil writes:  up, left, down, right
BMFont reads:  up, left, down, right

In order to make the padding ordering compatible with the [BMFont specification](http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/doc/file_format.html), I normalized all orderings to up, right, down, left.

data.title: Sounds stop playing after playing many sequentially
data.body:
After playing some sounds quickly sequentially (as quickly as I can tap keys on my keyboard), they stop playing (after like 4 - 5 seconds).

I'm on the 1.9.2 libgdx.

There's no stacktrace, just that I get the -1 on sound ids after playing ANY sound after the bug.
- [X] Windows
- [X] MacOS

The ones not listed I'm not sure about, I haven't able to test them there.

I'm thinking the sounds might be being disposed of because in the same game instance, if I reload the sounds, they all play fine.

Any ideas?

data.title: Hiero writes BMFont file padding with incorrect order
data.body:
#### Issue details

Hiero writes the padding array in the incorrect order, according to the [BMFont file specification](http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/doc/file_format.html). Both the file tags and binary versions specify the ordering as:  up, right, down, left.

Hiero is writing out the padding ordering as:  [up, left, down, right](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/f504a294a4aac57a3d43e2ab8cfa8c860ac90044/extensions/gdx-tools/src/com/badlogic/gdx/tools/hiero/BMFontUtil.java#L72).

I believe this is an error, but please let me know if it was intentional for any reason (I'm patching my local build; will submit a PR).
#### Reproduction steps/code

Run Hiero, File > Save BMFont files (text)... and open the BMFont file.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.4
#### Stacktrace
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: ButtonGroup throws ClassCastException when accessing through getAllChecked()
data.body:
Adding buttons to button group:

``` java
ButtonGroup<TextButton> btnGrp = new ButtonGroup<TextButton>();
TextButton btn = new TextButton("body", menu.buttonStyle);
btnGrp.add(btn);
```

Accessing clicked buttons:

``` java
Array<TextButton> btns = btnGrp.getAllChecked();
System.out.println(btns);
System.out.println(btns.toArray());
System.out.println(btns.items[0]);
```

Log:

```
[TextButton
|  Label: Body]
[Ljava.lang.Object;@16b9a615
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ClassCastException: [Ljava.lang.Object; cannot be cast to [Lcom.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.TextButton;
    Stacktrace to last 'accessing clicked buttons' line
```

---

Also has same exception here:

``` java
btns.toArray()[0]
```

affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

libgdx v: 1.9.4

data.body:
I am creating my first LibGDX demo project - FlappyBird and following @BrentAureli tutorials on this.

For reproducing the issue please follow this link, as I have done exactly what is listed here:
https://github.com/MobiDevelop/robovm/issues/13

To resolve the issue, I followed this thread:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/4091

I have also posted the question, screenshot, fixes and further problem in StackOverflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39263386/libgdx-project-modules-edit-configurations-in-android-studio

After doing all the changes in the above thread, I am still getting below error:

If my Gradle is in offline mode, I am getting this error:

```
Error:A problem occurred configuring root project 'FlappyBird'.

> Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':classpath'.
   > Could not resolve com.mobidevelop.robovm:robovm-gradle-plugin:2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Required by:
         :FlappyBird:unspecified
      > No cached version of com.mobidevelop.robovm:robovm-gradle-plugin:2.2.0-SNAPSHOT available for offline mode.
      > No cached version of com.mobidevelop.robovm:robovm-gradle-plugin:2.2.0-SNAPSHOT available for offline mode.
```

If I put my Gradle in Online mode, I am getting this error:

```
Error:A problem occurred configuring root project 'FlappyBird'.
> Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':classpath'.
   > Could not find com.mobidevelop.robovm:robovm-gradle-plugin:2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Searched in the following locations:
         file:/D:/ANDROID_STUDIO_IDE/gradle/m2repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
         file:/D:/ANDROID_STUDIO_IDE/gradle/m2repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.pom
         file:/D:/ANDROID_STUDIO_IDE/gradle/m2repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
         file:/C:/Users/Harry Suppal/.m2/repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
         file:/C:/Users/Harry Suppal/.m2/repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.pom
         file:/C:/Users/Harry Suppal/.m2/repository/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
         https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
         https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.pom
         https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
         https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
         https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/com/mobidevelop/robovm/robovm-gradle-plugin/2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/robovm-gradle-plugin-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT.pom

     Required by:
         :FlappyBird:unspecified
```

For the folders on my system, the compiler is not able to find "mobidevelop" folder in my IDE folder because there isn't any such folder there. But why the online links are not working?!

Is there any way I can download or upgrade the gradle to incorporate the 'mobidevelop' folder so that the project gets compiled in offline mode?

Furthermore, I am also not able to find the LibGdx sub-modules while creating the EditConfigurations for Desktop application - Please guide in this as well. 
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Android Studio Version - 2.1.2
#### Please select the affected platforms

Working on Windows 8

Creating LibGDX project for Android, iOS and Desktop

data.title: TexturePacker stripWhitespaceY offset is from bottom instead of top
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.
#### Issue details

The .atlas file output where stripWhitespaceY is enabled has the offset output from the bottom-left instead of the top-left.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Pack an image that's vertically off-centre such as:

![0006](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16719964/18158296/bb210f62-7022-11e6-9a18-81142a259bb9.png)

...with these settings in your pack.json:

``` json
{
    pot: true,
    paddingX: 2,
    paddingY: 2,
    bleed: true,
    edgePadding: true,
    duplicatePadding: false,
    rotation: true,
    minWidth: 16,
    minHeight: 16,
    maxWidth: 4096,
    maxHeight: 4096,
    square: false,
    stripWhitespaceX: true,
    stripWhitespaceY: true,
    alphaThreshold: 0,
    filterMin: Nearest,
    filterMag: Nearest,
    wrapX: ClampToEdge,
    wrapY: ClampToEdge,
    format: RGBA8888,
    alias: true,
    outputFormat: png,
    jpegQuality: 0.9,
    ignoreBlankImages: true,
    fast: false,
    debug: false,
    combineSubdirectories: true,
    flattenPaths: false,
    premultiplyAlpha: false,
    useIndexes: true,
    limitMemory: false,
    grid: false,
    scale: [ 1 ],
    scaleSuffix: [ "" ]
}
```

The output for that frame contains:

```
  size: 242, 405
  orig: 480, 700
  offset: 142, 53
```

The X part of the offset is correct, but the Y part is the distance from the bottom, rather than the top.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Nightly download of standalone tool from yesterday.
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Add cascading style support to Skin
data.body:
This will help clean up skin json files considerably. A prime use case is ImageButtonStyle (or ImageTextButtonStyle)--I find it is common to have many ImageButtonStyles in my skin with all the same values except for the Image. But I also have many other types of Button subclass styles where I am using some of the same values over and over. It becomes error prone to make tweaks to these parameters and keep the visual look of all the buttons the same.

Usage: For any style definition, you can specify a `parent` in the Json that names another style to use for default values. The parent can be a superclass style, so a TextButtonStyle could use a ButtonStyle as a parent, for example. You then only need to specify parameters that have different values than those of the parent.

data.title: Fix for issue #3994.
data.body:
Fixes issue #3994 where the Java renderer does not correctly set the BMFont xoffset because `charVector` was not being used.

I was experiencing this issue as well because I want to use the Java renderer in Hiero.  It looks like a simple bug; I compiled Hiero with this change and the fix corrects `xoffset`.  To test, I'm saving Arial using Java Rendering, the Extended character set, and setting 1 page of size 1024x512.  Attached are `.fnt` files before and after the fix (renamed to `.txt` for Github upload).  Notice `xoffset=2` for every character in the "before" file.  The "after" file with this fix renders correctly for me.
[arial-after-fix.txt](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/446252/arial-after-fix.txt)
[arial-before-fix.txt](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/446251/arial-before-fix.txt)
